result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Albert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. Court will allow electronic contact as long as agent in aware. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medication without a valid prescription.

timeConds.notes:
with work release privileges.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
Consecutive to:
Complete 50 hours of community service work for each year of probation for a total of 200 hours without buyout option.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

Violation/Revocation Summary.
Violation/Revocation Summary.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

The above named defendant having appeared before the Court on May 13, 2022, and having been convicted of  Battery; Domestic Abuse Repeater and Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), contrary to Sec. 940.19(1) and 961.41(3g)(e),  Wis. Stats., at which time the defendant was ordered to serve a mandatory jail sentence of  (6) months which was to commence on July 12, 2022, and the defendant having failed to turn him/herself in the  Walworth County Sheriff's Department as ordered by the Court.
THE STATE OF WISCONSIN, TO ANY LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER:
NOW, THEREFORE, You are commanded forthwith to arrest and bring the said defendant to the Walworth County Sheriff's Department to serve said sentence.

2:00 PM Defendant Richard J Albert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kim appeared in court.
Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm. 
Attorney Albert plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Albert in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Richard J Albert. Motion to modify bond by defense. Denied. Bond remains. State objects to bond modification. Victim is present and makes statement. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Richard J Albert in court.  Attorney JJ Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Richard J Albert.  Called @ 1:46 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for initial appearance on 22CF184 and further proceedings on 22CF42. Record by Atty. Kim who wants to address bond. Court instructs him to file proper motion and sets both matters over for bond motion. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Albert in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Richard J Albert. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 2GF298 & 22CF42
MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.P.K. (dob 12/26/1965) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1471 thru 22-1473

Defendant not in court. Attorney Tony Kim appears. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant working in Sheyboygan. State will be filing other acts motion. Vitim is present and makes request regarding no contact. Defendant has not had evaluation. Court will require defense to file formal motion. Minutes filed.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Kim acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all counts on behalf of his client.
